text.0: :white_heavy_check_mark: We are LIVE: Join the conversation about :backhand_index_pointing_right: Protecting populations in vulnerable situations in the context of #COVID19 https://t.co/fjkN4M7Lm0
text.1: Thanks Teruo Tanaka, from :Japan:'s Kotobuki music, for sharing your beautiful music with me & @WHO colleagues. We are touched by your gesture & inspired by your group's creative way of communicating about the #COVID19 crisis. You are right - we will win against the coronavirus! https://t.co/NtUEl9Aycg
text.2:
"It will work with organizations dealing with the broad spectrum of health issues affecting youth today.

Young people aren’t just the future, they’re the present and we must hear their voice and experience to build the post pandemic world together"-@DrTedros
text.3:
"#COVID19 has affected young people a great deal, including mental health. 

The Youth Council will serve as a platform for designing and incubating new initiatives and for maintaining and expanding existing meaningful youth engagement initiatives of WHO"-@DrTedros
text.4:
"It’s important that all groups have a voice in the future of health and the planet. 

In this regard, today I am announcing the launch of a WHO Youth Council, which will provide advice on key health and development issues affecting young people"-@DrTedros
text.5:
"The report provides initial lessons and recommendations. 

However, like with everything in this pandemic, we need to learn fast and be ready to quickly adapt our strategies"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://t.co/mf3LIvqQ4T https://t.co/EOaFnNwu9G
text.6: "The WHO Technical Advisory Group on Behavioural Insights and Sciences for Health, which is chaired by Professor @CassSunstein, released a report this week focused on how best to ensure high coverage of new #COVID19 vaccines"-@DrTedros https://t.co/mf3LIvqQ4T https://t.co/eT84puyfKk
text.7: "As well as ensuring supply, manufacturing, logistics and funds are all in place, it’s important to ensure that leaders communicate with their populations about the importance of #COVID19 vaccination and how and where to get it"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.8: "To ensure that this effort becomes a reality, the @ACTAccelerator, urgently requires a cash injection of $4.3 B to fast-track critical areas of work & ensure that rapid tests, treatments & new #COVID19 vaccines are distributed equitably"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.9: "COVAX, has already secured 700 million doses of three #COVID19 vaccines and next year we aim to use additional funds to ensure that at least two billion doses of safe and effective vaccines are available around the world"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.10: "The payoff from this will be huge. New research by the @EurasiaGroup found that the economic benefits of a global equitable #COVID19 vaccine solution alone for just 10 high-income countries would be at least $153B in 2020-21, rising to $466B by 2025"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.11: "As supply increases, #COVID19 vaccines will be rolled out to cover 20% of the population of participating countries and economies, which will ensure further high-risk groups are covered"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.12: "In the first phase of the rollout, sufficient doses will be provided to cover health and social care workers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.13: "The COVAX Facility, which is the vaccine arm of the @ACTAccelerator, intends to provide doses to enable the 189 countries and economies to vaccinate those at highest risk of the virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.14: "For decision makers, this means passing any legislation and policies needed to expedite the process, ensuring the regulatory process is fit for purpose and confirming that the financing is in place"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.15: "This will form the basis of national deployment and vaccination plans, which will outline how to rollout the #COVID19 vaccines and identify any potential bottlenecks that will need to be planned for"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.16: ":keycap_digit_one: we’re asking all countries to do a country readiness assessment that takes into account cold chain, health worker capacity, micro-planning, initial target populations and training"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.17: "A new hundred-hundred initiative - a major sprint by WHO, @UNICEF, @WorldBank, @GlobalFund and @gavi – aims to help 100 countries conduct rapid readiness assessments and country-specific plans within 100 days for vaccines and other #COVID19 tools"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.18: "WHO is engaged with our partners at all levels, working to boost manufacturing and ensure rollout of #COVID19 vaccines"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.19:
"With vaccines now being introduced, it’s really important that they are distributed equitably around the world. 

Since @gavi, @CEPIvaccines & WHO set up the COVAX Facility in April of this year, 189 countries and economies have backed it"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.20: "The #COVID19 pandemic still has a long a way to run and decisions made by leaders and citizens in the coming days will determine both the course of the virus in the short term and when this pandemic will ultimately end"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.21: "My personal ask to people is simple, please be careful, think of #healthworkers and act for the greater good, because it will save lives and livelihoods"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.22: "We know it’s been a hard year and people are tired, but in hospitals that are running at, or over, capacity; it’s the hardest it can possibly be"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.23:
"Even as #COVID19 vaccines are rolled out, people will need to keep adhering to public health measures so that everyone is protected"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/7h8CGyc1Yt
text.24: "As previously seen, as these measures are lifted, it’s important that people should continue to follow national and local measures to ensure that cases do not rebound"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.25: "Some countries in Europe have managed to reduce transmission of the #COVID19 virus by putting stringent measures in place that limit people from mingling"-@DrTedros
text.26: "The truth is that at present, many places are witnessing very high transmission of the #COVID19 virus, which is putting enormous pressure on hospitals, intensive care units and #healthworkers"-@DrTedros
text.27:
"Progress on vaccines gives us all a lift and we can now start to see the light at the end of the tunnel.  

However, WHO is concerned that there is a growing perception that the #COVID19 pandemic is over"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.28: "Just like with the :United_Kingdom:’s findings on #dexamethasone in the summer, this is an important scientific step for the world as vaccines will be critical in the battle against #COVID19"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.29:
"This week, I was pleased to see that the @MHRAgovuk gave an emergency authorization for the Pfizer/BioNTech #COVID19 vaccine for rollout"-@DrTedros #ACTogether 

https://t.co/fDqlhuhfLr
text.31:
"75 years after its birth, the @UN remains more relevant than ever, and more essential than ever. 

WHO is proud to be part of the :United_Nations: family.

We remain committed to working with all countries to ensure the United Nations lives up to its name and aspirations"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.32: "A vision that affirms our common history and our common future; that recognizes we are richer for our diversity, and that we are more than the sum of our parts"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.33: "Before us lies a new path: a path on which nations don't see themselves as rivals in a 0-sum game, but as fellow-travelers with the same aspirations, hopes & dreams"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.34:
"The pandemic has brought us to a fork in the road. 

Behind us lies the path of business as usual – the path that led us to this crisis"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.35: "But we cannot – we must not – go back to the same exploitative patterns of production & consumption, the same disregard for the planet that sustains all life, the same cycle of panic & neglect, a& the same divisive politics that fueled this #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.36: "Humanity has overcome many plagues and pandemics before, and we will overcome this one"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.37:
"And together, we must harness that same urgency and innovation to address the full range of challenges we face.

No one else will do it, and it cannot wait. 

It must be us, and it must be now"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.38:
"That type of collaboration – between partners and between countries – must be the hallmark of the post-pandemic era.

Together we have shown that in the face of a global crisis, the world can come together in new ways to solve urgent problems"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.39: "Last year, WHO and 11 other multilateral agencies came together to launch the Global Action Plan on Healthy Lives and Well-being for All, to support countries to accelerate towards the health-related @GlobalGoalsUN targets"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.40:
"Together, we must once again choose convergence.

Together, we must heed the Secretary-General’s clarion call for a Decade of Action to pursue the @GlobalGoalsUN with even more innovation and determination"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.41: "The Paris Agreement has been undermined; the commitments made in the Addis Ababa Action Agenda have gone largely unfulfilled; and although there has been progress toward the @GlobalGoalsUN, too often our efforts have remained siloed and splintered"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.42: "The same year, nations adopted the Paris Agreement & the Addis Ababa Action Agenda on finance for development, which I had the honour to chair. The :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: converged around a common vision for the future. But in the years since, we have witnessed a dangerous divergence"-@DrTedros
text.43:
"Once the #COVID19 pandemic ends, we will be left with even greater challenges than before it started. 

In 2015, the nations of the world adopted the @GlobalGoalsUN, with their sweeping vision for people, planet, prosperity, peace and partnership"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.44:
":keycap_digit_four: invest in multilateralism to safeguard our common future.

A vaccine will help to end the#COVID19 pandemic. But it will not address the vulnerabilities that lie at its root. 

There is no vaccine for poverty, hunger, inequality or climate change"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.45: "If the world is to avoid another crisis on this scale, investments in basic public health functions – and especially #primaryhealthcare – are essential"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.46: "In particular, strong #primaryhealthcare is the eyes and ears of every health system, and is essential for preventing and responding to emergencies of all kinds, from the personal crisis of a heart attack to an outbreak of a new and deadly virus"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.47: "Those things have great value, but too many countries have neglected investments in basic public health functions, which are the bedrock of safe and healthy nations"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.48:
"Universal health coverage is built on strong health systems. 

Many of the countries hit hardest by #COVID19 are those with highly medicalized health systems, with access to the world’s most advanced drugs, devices and specialists"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.49: "Shouldn’t that also be true for a crisis like cancer, heart disease, HIV, TB or malaria? Shouldn’t it also be true for services like routine immunization, maternal care and tobacco control, which can prevent a crisis – and the costs of dealing with it?"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.50: "In the face of the pandemic, many countries have offered free testing & treatment for #COVID19, & have promised free vaccination for their populations. They've recognized that the ability to pay should not be the difference between sickness & health, & life & death"-@DrTedros
text.51:
"You embraced a vision for a world in which all people have access to essential health services, without facing financial hardship.

The #COVID19 pandemic has only underlined why universal health coverage is so important"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll
text.52:
"The good news is that there is already strong political commitment for health. 

At last year’s General Assembly, all @UN Member States converged to endorse the high-level political declaration on universal health coverage"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll
text.53: "The council will be chaired by the distinguished economist Professor @MazzucatoM, and Her Excellency @MarinSanna, the Prime Minister of #Finland, has generously agreed to be its patron"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.54:
"We need a radical rethink of the way we view and value health. 

Accordingly, I have established a new Council on the Economics of #HealthForAll, to examine and elucidate the links between health and inclusive, innovation-led economic growth"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.55:
"The world spends 7.5 trillion dollars on health every year – almost 10% of global GDP. 

But most of this spending is in the richest countries, and is disproportionately directed to treating disease, rather than promoting and protecting health"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.56:
"The risks of under-investment in health have wide-ranging impacts, and so do the benefits of investing in health.

Health is an investment in successful societies. It enables individuals, families, communities and nations to flourish"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.57: "Millions of people have lost their livelihoods, the global economy has been plunged into its sharpest downturn since the Great Depression, geopolitical fissures have widened, and the multilateral system has been called into question"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.58:
":keycap_digit_three: invest in health as the foundation of peace & prosperity.

The pandemic has proven that a health crisis is not just a health crisis; it is a social, economic, political and humanitarian crisis"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.59: "#Switzerland has generously offered the use of a high-security laboratory at which WHO would manage a new “biobank”, and we are now developing the framework under which samples would be provided and shared"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.60: "The #COVID19 pandemic has also shown that there is an urgent need for a globally agreed system for sharing pathogen materials and clinical samples, to facilitate the rapid development of medical countermeasures as global public goods"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.61: "In addition, we welcome the initiative proposed by the @eucopresident Charles Michel for an international treaty to provide the political underpinning for strengthening the implementation of the International Health Regulations and global health security"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.62: "WHO is engaging with several countries on developing & piloting a new mechanism, the Universal Health & Preparedness Review, in which countries agree to a regular & transparent process of peer review, similar to the Universal Periodic Review used by the #HRC"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.63: "In September I established a committee to review the functioning of the IHR during the #COVID19 pandemic, & to provide recommendations on how to strengthen its implementation – incl. the binary mechanism for declaring a public health emergency of international concern"-@DrTedros
text.64: "It’s clear that the International Health Regulations can only be successful if it’s based on mutual trust, mutual accountability, mutual transparency and robust political legitimacy"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.65:
"It’s also clear that the global system for preparedness needs attention. 

The International Health Regulations is a powerful legal tool, but countries must use it more effectively"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.66:
"Many of the countries that have done best are those with recent experience of responding to SARS, MERS & other disease outbreaks.
Now all countries must develop the same “muscle memory”, invest in the measures that will predict, prevent, control & mitigate next crisis"-@DrTedros
text.67:
":keycap_digit_two: invest in preparedness to prevent the next pandemic. 

Despite years of warnings, many countries were simply not ready for #COVID19.

Many mistakenly assumed their strong health systems would protect them"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.68:
"That’s less than half of 1% of the $11 trillion of stimulus packages announced by #G20 countries so far.
Vaccines are an investment that will be repaid rapidly & many times over. Sharing the fruits of science is not charity, it’s in the best interests of every nation"-@DrTedros
text.69:
"A further 23.9 billion dollars will be needed next year"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #ACTogether 

https://t.co/OaPczQiIxb
text.70: "Unless the @ACTAccelerator is fully funded, it's in danger of becoming no more than a noble gesture. It faces an immediate funding gap of $4.3B to lay the groundwork for the mass procurement & delivery of vaccines, diagnostics & therapeutics"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #ACTogether
text.71:
"We've secured supplies of #dexamethasone – the only :pill: shown to reduce the risk of death from #COVID19 – for up to 4.5M patients in lower-income countries.

As part of the @ACTAccelerator, 189 countries & economies are participating in the COVAX facility"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.72:
"Already the @ACTAccelerator has delivered real results. 

We have reached agreement for the purchase of 120 million low-cost, rapid diagnostic tests for low- and middle-income countries"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #ACTogether
text.73:
"In April, with support from many partners, WHO established the @ACTAccelerator. 

This is a completely unprecedented partnership with two aims: to develop vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics fast; and allocate and deliver them fairly"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #ACTogether
text.74:
"The task of narrowing inequalities does not start after the #COVID19 pandemic. It must be part and parcel of the response. 

If the world fails this test, what hope is there of living up to the scope and scale of the @GlobalGoalsUN?"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #ACTogether
text.75:
"#COVID19 is a global crisis, and the solutions must be shared equitably as global public goods, not as private commodities that widen inequalities and become yet another reason some people are left behind.
This is true between countries, and within countries"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.76: "But let me be clear: we simply cannot accept a world in which the poor and marginalized are trampled by the rich and powerful in the stampede for #COVID19 vaccines"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #ACTogether
text.77:
":keycap_digit_one: invest in vaccines to end the pandemic.
With positive results in recent weeks from vaccine trials, the light at the end of the tunnel is growing steadily brighter. Although the path ahead remains treacherous, we can begin to glimpse the end of #COVID19 "-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.78: "Today I would like to outline :keycap_digit_four: key areas in which we need the leadership of nations – as @UN – to end the #COVID19 pandemic and build the post-pandemic world"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.80: "Many countries have succeeded in preventing or containing widespread transmission of #COVID19 with proven public health tools. This is not a fluke of geography or demography. These countries have proven that with science, solidarity & sacrifice this virus can be tamed"-@DrTedros
text.81:
"More than 60M #COVID19 cases have now been reported to WHO, & 1.5M people have lost their lives.
Although this is a global health crisis, it’s important to remember that not all countries have responded equally, & not all countries have been affected equally"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.82:
"#COVID19 has shown what humanity is capable of at its best & worst:
Inspiring acts of compassion & self-sacrifice
Breathtaking feats of science & innovation
:heart_suit_selector:-warming demonstrations of solidarity
But also disturbing signs of self-interest, blame-shifting &  division"-@DrTedros
text.83: "For example, we worked closely with the @WFP, @UNICEF and other partners to establish the @UN Supply Chain Platform, delivering millions of tests and items of personal protective equipment to 179 countries and territories"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #COVID19
text.84: "We’ve worked with colleagues across the @UN family in multiple areas including supply chains, travel, communications, mass gatherings, the animal-human interface, joint work in countries and much more"-@DrTedros
text.85: "Although #COVID19 is a health crisis, it has had implications for every area of the @UN’s work. In the earliest days of the pandemic, the Secretary-General @antonioguterres & I agreed to trigger the UN Crisis Management Team, which has been led by @DrMikeRyan"-@DrTedros #UNGASS
text.86:
"There have been challenges and lessons to learn for all us, but the #COVID19 pandemic has demonstrated what the @UN at its best can do"-@DrTedros #UNGASS 

https://t.co/CwtVcYTZ24
text.87: "In the past 75 years, the @UN has had many successes, and many challenges. But none more than the #COVID19 pandemic, which has strained the very fabric of multilateralism"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #UN75
text.88:
"That project, of course, was the United Nations :United_Nations:"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #UN75

https://t.co/XOJId2LJiI
text.89: "75 years ago, as the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: lay smouldering from the 2nd global conflict in 30 years, a new project was conceived – a project born of suffering, death & loss, but also of hope, & the blinding realization that there is no future but a common future"-@DrTedros #UNGASS #UN75
text.90: Live with @DrTedros from the #UNGASS on #COVID19 https://t.co/5OjT5zJW7N
text.91:
More than :keycap_digit_one::keycap_digit_zero::keycap_digit_zero: million people in the @WHOWPRO Region suffer from #mentalhealth disorders.

WHO is calling for a massive scale-up in investment in mental health to support those in need. More info :backhand_index_pointing_right:https://t.co/ta3ZHolEch https://t.co/UBaphm6L7K
text.92:
#COVID19 is an unprecedented crisis that demands an unprecedented response & innovation. Pleased to join @WebSummit alongside @antoniocostapm, & share @WHO's views on how to harness the power of innovation & digital technologies to deliver #HealthForAll.
https://t.co/Fin8m0Tc4Y
text.93:
“Virginity testing” is a violation of the human rights of girls and women, and can be detrimental to women’s and girls’ physical, psychological and social well-being.

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/gPE26Q1BrY 

#16Days https://t.co/yRXn3kxzrP
